titleStmt.title: Inquisitio Anglicana: or The disguise discovered. Shevving the proceedings of the commissioners at White hall, for the approbation of ministers, in the examinations of Anthony Sadler Cler: (chaplain to the Right Honourable the Lady Pagett, dowager) vvhose delay, triall, suspence and vvrong, presents it self for remedy, to the Ld Protector, and the High Court of Parliament: and for information to the clergy, and all the people of the nation.
titleStmt.author: Sadler, Anthony, b. 1610.

titleStmt.title: Inquisitio Anglicana: or The disguise discovered. Shevving the proceedings of the commissioners at White hall, for the approbation of ministers, in the examinations of Anthony Sadler Cler: (chaplain to the Right Honourable the Lady Pagett, dowager) vvhose delay, triall, suspence and vvrong, presents it self for remedy, to the Ld Protector, and the High Court of Parliament: and for information to the clergy, and all the people of the nation.
titleStmt.author: Sadler, Anthony, b. 1610.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J. Grismond, for Richard Royston at the Angel in Ivie-lane,

notesStmt.note: A variant has: a comma after "or", a period after "Ld" and a period after "Parliament" in lines 2, 12 and 13, respectively, of the title page.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

orgName.name: England and Wales.
Commissioners for Approbation of Public Preachers.
